channel.title: Homes on Guangyao (Stannis) Zhou
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Guangyao (Stannis) Zhou

item.description: About I’m a Postdoctoral Associate in the Division of Applied Math, Brown University, working with Prof. Stuart Geman. Previously, I got my Ph.D. in Applied Math at Brown University, and my bachelor degrees from Peking University. Here’s my CV. I’m interested in using probabilistic and statistical methods to understand Kinetics v.s. Thermodynamics in the folding of RNA molecules Compositional Probabilistic Generative Models for Computer Vision My methodological research has focused on

item.title: Teaching
item.description: At Brown University: Teaching Assistant, APMA 1650 Statistical Inference, Fall 2013 Teaching Assistant, APMA 0650 Essential Statistics, Spring 2014 Substitute Lecturer, APMA 2610 Recent Applications of Probability and Statistics, Spring 2015 Mentor, APMA Grad-Undergrad Mentoring Program, Fall 2016&Spring 2017
